website_summaries.verdict: It's expensive, but you'll appreciate the quality control in this organic product.
pros: Fully USDA certified organic product that's non-GMO, gluten-free, and vegan
Delivers the extra protein, omega fats, and fiber you expect from chia seeds
Clean, organic product with little to no foreign plant matter in the bag
cons: Far more expensive per pound than other chia seeds products

customer_reviews.title: Expired
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try these white chia seeds for a new recipe however, when the time came to open I saw the best by date of 01/2018. I tried to return and a message saying not eligible for return?? Even with an unopened package and an expiration date of 11 months earlier? Hmmm quite the rip I would say. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: pierpontpatti

customer_reviews.title: Sift every bag with wire strainer
customer_reviews.text: My last truthful review was censored, so let me just say thins: buy a wire strainer, you know the type you use to sift flour? Sift every bag, even if previous was clean. Hint: chia doesn't have legs and aren't 1/4-3/8" long and crunchy when cut by knife (review of raw seeds). thin things are stems, which aren't harmful unless sprayed with pesticide or herbicde, just poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: a lesson learned

customer_reviews.title: Awful headache
customer_reviews.text: This product gave me the worst headache after consuming it. I’ve never had a problem with chia seeds before. I don’t know what they are putting in this product Upon further research I learn that brown chia seeds are immature seeds and don’t have the same nutritional quality as the black or white seeds. My bag was about 50% brown seeds interspersed with the regular seeds. My bag also smelled funny when I opened it. This is also my second bag they sent me as the first bag was full of pebbles. I don’t trust this company
customer_reviews.author: Soulva

customer_reviews.title: Scary but good
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to get more health conscious so I decided to give these little guys a try since I've heard so much about their health benefits. I wasn't sure really what the difference between white chia seeds and black chia seeds but I decided to try try the white (the black ones reminded me of little bugs). I love these seeds. I've been letting them sit in my yogurt and smoothies and they've been yummy. I was a little worried and scared about the consistency cuz I have a bit of an issue with texture but these were completely fine. Kudos to these little seeds for helping me eat a little healthier.
customer_reviews.author: Jettmom3Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: News Flash: Husband no longer freaked-out by chia seeds in his oatmeal...
customer_reviews.text: Black chia doesn't bother me, but with the rest of the family, it's a household challenge to get them to add a little superfood to things like yogurt and oatmeal. Husband likens black chia to little bugs, and since they're also crunchy, the combination completely freaks him out. So I had an idea: white chia! These seeds taste, look, and smell like chia, of course, but they're white, so they don't weird-out my husband when he puts them into his light-colored foods. Win!!
customer_reviews.author: CyberHez

customer_reviews.title: yummy, and good for you...amazing!
customer_reviews.text: these white chia seeds have mild flavor that i enjoy as a breakfast pudding treat. i combine the chia seed with cashew milk, raspberry kefir, coconut water, or other variations (a little plain yogurt to add tartness to the sweet), depending on my taste mood. sometimes i also add some hulled hemp seed for added nutrition and fiber. also good is cocoa or cacao, honey and a non-dairy milk mix, sometimes with a small amount of vanilla. the variables are endless, of course. it's all as good tasting as dessert, while providing great health benefits. here's to your health!
customer_reviews.author: naz

customer_reviews.title: Great for chia seeds pudding, with mild flavor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chia seeds for making chia seeds pudding. I mixed them with coconut milk and left them overnight in the fridge. They swell and become gel like texture the next day, very similar to tapioca texture. Since I like tapioca a lot, I thought this chia seeds pudding are a great substitute. They have mild taste compared to the black chia seeds I got from the store. Also the chia seeds I got from the store never swell, and very nutty flavor; therefore I am pleasantly surprised with this brand of white chia seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Irene J.

customer_reviews.title: White Seeds of Healthy Goodness!
customer_reviews.text: Love these chia seeds- I had a visual issue with black specks in my food, thus the white. I've made chia pudding with these and other baked goods. Great supplement and they have no taste. I've found they are best in cold puddings if you leave them in the refrigerator for at least 24 hours. No crunchiness then- and they taste like tapioca pudding! Much better price on Amazon, you get twice the weight for the same price as 8 oz in a grocery or big box store and they're organic. Will purchase this brand again when I run out.
customer_reviews.author: Mafiachix

customer_reviews.title: Spoiled!
customer_reviews.text: Chia seeds arrived in a beaten up bag and they are spoiled even though the date is still good on them!
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Love my Chia Breakfast
customer_reviews.text: I have been enjoying my white chia seed breakfast for a number of months now, We make it with Almond milk and then add some fresh honey to it. I love the taste and enjoy the white chia seeds because they don't show up in my teeth afterwards. I feel full till noon. Great tsdting product!! JB
customer_reviews.author: J Baker

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: terrasoul chia seeds seem like good quality to me. also a good price. unfortunately i never received this order
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price and good product
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that this is organic and I love the color over black. I'm not sure if there is a difference in nutritional value. I personally put a tablespoon of chia seed into my Greek yogurt and add vanilla stevia. I really can't taste the chia, so it must be fairly neutral in taste. I don't grind it, and I'm not sure if I am supposed to, to reap all the benefits. It's a super food and good fiber, so it's a win win for me.
customer_reviews.author: outdoors gal

customer_reviews.title: Smoothie additive
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because it has high omega levels and it works great when making a smoothie because it thickens the mixture. Which of course makes for a really great smoothie as if you bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Kamenriderthrust

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These taste fresh and white doesn't show up on teeth, lol. No issues with gravel or small stones, these are cleaned well. Great for smoothies! Repeat purchase.
customer_reviews.author: cards&crafts

customer_reviews.title: Try them!
customer_reviews.text: My mother makes chia seed pudding. She used the black chia but said she would like to try the white. Not sure if it’s a mind game with her but she says these are softer and she really likes them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeshanna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent taste texture representation.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product to use in a keto bread recipe. I turned out fantastically. I will order this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt B

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant taste
customer_reviews.text: I add chia seeds to my overnight oats, and I'm happy with the subtle flavor of these white seeds (as compared to the black, which have a stronger, oily taste). The product arrived promptly and in excellent condition. If you use chia seed in your diet, I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Wonderful Quality Egg Replacer!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff! I had been using black chia seeds as an egg replacer (1T chia to 3T hot water), however, some recipes it's nicer to not have black speckles all through. This white chia binds maybe even better than the black, and without the speckles.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great, but more expensive than other nice chia seeds
customer_reviews.text: These were the first chia seeds I tried and I bought them to make "chia pudding" with and they worked great, and I now use a lot of chia seeds. I doubt that I will purchase them again because while I like them I can get good quality black chia seeds that are much less expensive and I use enough that I notice the price difference, as I pay less than half what I paid for these. However, if price isn't an issue, then I'd go with these
customer_reviews.author: Frobisher

customer_reviews.title: Fun for adding nutrition to almost anything.
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of Chia seeds until I had surgery and was on a puree diet for four weeks. I was telling a friend I always felt hungry. She suggested adding Chia seeds to my smoothies, juice, soups etc...to help me feel full. These tiny little seeds swell and have a fun texture. They are loaded full of nutrition for being so small. I suggest going to the productlink for more info.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have a difficult time finding "white" chia seeds. They seem softer then black. Good price and fast delivery. So glad I found Terrasoul brand on Amazon. Also is organic which is all I will buy. Hope this product continues to be available in Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what she was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: My wife saw a post about adding chia seeds to drinks for a small protein boost. We had regular chia seeds, but they didn't turn out like what she read. These white chia did the trick! She's very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cantley

customer_reviews.title: Great Chia
customer_reviews.text: I use White Chia everyday and have ordered TerraSoul about 10X...excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: hollywood123

customer_reviews.title: I like this white chia seed except few black one in it.
customer_reviews.text: I like white chia seed. However, there is few black inclusion on this products. I don't know what it is.Does not look like black chia seed. Because, does not turn to gel after add on water. I hope safe enough to eat black one. Otherwise I like white chia seed better than black chia seed.
customer_reviews.author: JURI

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The product is as described and as expected. I would repurchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Acct Exec

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely happy I decided on this brand & have actually referred ...
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy I decided on this brand & have actually referred 3 of my friends to try it! It definitely is helping with my exhaustion. I'm not running marathons by any means but I'm also no longer begging for a mid day nap! So far I really like this product
customer_reviews.author: Leapin Lizzard

customer_reviews.title: Love in oatmeal. Prefer of the the "eyes" of the dark ones.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe there is no difference based on color - but these are just easier to take as they are lighter in color. I use daily in oatmeal and love that they just blend in so I don't have the "eyes" glaring so brightly at me as the black ones when I make puddings or drinks.
customer_reviews.author: Julie N.

customer_reviews.title: perfect health food
customer_reviews.text: excellent product, use it every day with breakfast cereal. Have bought it several times.
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: White Chia Seeds -- Delicious & Nutritious!
customer_reviews.text: These white chia seeds were recommended by the nutritionist for the show, The Biggest Loser, because they are raw and therefore more nutritious. Neither my local health food store, nor local grocery stores, carried the white version. It was easy to order from Amazon. The icing on the cake is the fact that I absolutely love the taste and texture of these seeds.

customer_reviews.title: Delicious. Only complaint is that the "best by" date ...
customer_reviews.text: Delicious. Only complaint is that the "best by" date was only a couple months out from when I received it. I use these frequently but the date is now past.
customer_reviews.author: Ellyn McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Happy chia pudding making time to me
customer_reviews.text: Happy chia pudding making time to me! I also needed the white chia seeds when I need to diminish the dark speckling you get from the black ones such as in some of the baked goods and homemade pastas. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Millie

customer_reviews.title: Terrasoul has consistently provided great products.
customer_reviews.text: I have liked each product I've received from Terrasoul. I use these in puddings , smoothies and other good foods. Thank You Terrasoul

customer_reviews.title: Not happy at all
customer_reviews.text: Not happy at all. The package that I received expired on 11/2016 (one year ago!). Now I have to go through the trouble of sending it back and request a refund.

customer_reviews.title: Yummy and good for you!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these at my sisters' bequest to add to our home brew Kombucha! I normally use black chia but she said white was better. I now concur that these are super yummy and this brand is high quality and a great value! I will order again! Highly recommend!

customer_reviews.title: Yum!
customer_reviews.text: I love white chia seeds. They are great for thickening foods without adding a muddy color. They have a mild taste and make great pudding.

customer_reviews.text: These are great seeds and I like that they are white. I can add them to almond milk and whatever and they don't have the icky gray color the black ones have

customer_reviews.text: Love the chia seeds. I enjoy making this with coconut almond milk, a little bit goes a long way. Very filling and it will take on the flavor of whatever you mix it with.

I had tried this recipe with another chia seed and this one came out much better. Also, I used the white seeds so that the strawberry color was more appetizing. Thank you !

customer_reviews.title: Not good. The second problem is that this is sold ...
customer_reviews.text: My first problem was that I was able to find several twigs in this bag. Not good. The second problem is that this is sold as white chia seeds, but it also contains quite a few black chia seeds. Having some black seeds is typical of most brands, but there are also brands out there that have less black seeds, or almost none. I know the white and black seeds are the same, but it make a difference when you're trying to make a dessert and want to make it look good. Overall, OK product, but has some quality control issues.

product_meta.title: Terrasoul Superfoods Organic White Chia Seeds, 16 Oz - Omega Fats | Fiber | Plant Protein…
feature_bullets: Terrasoul Superfoods Organic White Chia Seeds, 16oz Package
Certified Organic, Non-GMO, Earth Kosher, Raw, Gluten-Free, Vegan
White chia seeds are a great source of calcium, healthy omega fats, protein, antioxidants, and dietary fiber.

Terrasoul Superfoods sources the freshest and highest quality superfoods from all over the planet. Our mission is to make these amazing, healthy foods available to you at the lowest prices possible while paying our growers and employees fair wages.
100% Money-Back Satisfaction Guarantee - We stand behind our products and offer a 30-day money back guarantee, backed by an outstanding customer service team.
